title: Change in levels due to charge

content.question: The figure shows some energy levels of hydrogen. If the magnitude of the elementary charge were <math alttext="10 e" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>10</mn><mi>e</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> instead of <math alttext="e" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, how would the ground state energy of hydrogen be affected?

choices.label: It would have a much larger magnitude.
It would have a much smaller magnitude.
It would depend on which energy state the atom is actually in.

content.answer: It would have a much larger magnitude.

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
